About Me

I l❤ve storytelling, photography, and coding.

Hi! üëã

I'm üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Elena.

I'm a first-generation Canadian from Mexico, currently based inüìçsouthern Alberta, Canada, close to the world's largest known glacial erratic.

I combine my professional experiences and knowledge with my creativity and desire for positive change to create meaningful, informative, and motivating work.

With over a decade of professional experience in ten countries across three continents, I've worked as a media and communications specialist for different organizations in the humanitarian and international development sectors.

I've written about and have managed strategies and digital products on a wide range of topics like human rights and governance, environmental sustainability, HIV education and prevention, press freedom, gender equality, and cooperative agricultural entrepreneurship.

I'm responsible for the communications of an international coalition led by the Ottawa-based organization Action Canada. It's focused on advacing comprehensive sexual and reproductive health and rights of adolescent girls in Latin America.

I'm passionate about harnessing media and communications as tools to amplify voice, facilitate meaningful participation, and foster social change.

I see code as an ideal complement to these tools. It enhances storytelling and makes sense of information in exciting and engaging ways.

☞ Want to work with me? I'm available for small freelance opportunities. Let's talk!


What I Do

  • Content development
  • Strategy for communications and/or social media
  • Training on media and/or social media
  • Social media/product management
  • Writing, revising, editing, and copywriting
  • HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Research and fact-checking
